dialogue: Doctor: Is there anything else you've noticed around this spot?
Patient: Yes, there is a small, raised area just to the left of this spot. It's not as dark and seems to be a different texture.
Doctor: How does the surface of this area feel compared to your other skin?
Patient: The surface of this area feels slightly rougher and more uneven compared to my other skin.
Doctor: Do you have any sensations like itching or burning around this area?
Patient: No, I don't feel any itching or burning around this area. It just looks like a dark spot on my skin.
Doctor: Where on your body is this lesion located?
Patient: This lesion is located on my left arm, near the base of my thumb.
Doctor: Can you describe how big this spot is and its shape?
Patient: The spot is quite large, covering a significant portion of my skin, and it has an irregular, somewhat oval shape.
Doctor: What color is this area compared to your other skin?
Patient: This area is darker than my other skin.
Doctor: Is the edge of this spot clear or do you notice any irregularity?
Patient: The edge of this spot seems to be somewhat irregular, with a less defined boundary compared to the surrounding skin.
Doctor: How often do you notice this spot?
Patient: I usually notice this spot when I'm in the sun or after a shower.
